metadata.titel_preek: Epiphany and the Baptism of the Lord

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God interrupts human mundane reality and sin through an 'irruption of grace' to save and re-commission the incompetent human subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: God draws near to them both
He puts redemption into our blanket

object.identificatie: Salvation, New Life, and the removal of fear/sin
tekstueel_bewijs: the firm ground of their salvation
bringing the gifts of new life

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Holy One of Israel
tekstueel_bewijs: the God who terrifies is also the one who loves us for all eternity
the source of all good things... mercy from above

ontvanger.identificatie: Humanity (Gideon, Peter, the addict, the Hearer)
tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all

helper.identificatie: The 'Enabling Word' / The Holy Spirit / The Angel
tekstueel_bewijs: anoint him with the Holy Spirit
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides His own help.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that creates internal competence.

tekstueel_bewijs: sin, death, and the devil (implied by 'lost')
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as an ontological state ('deep in sin') and a power that would lead to being 'lost' if not for divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of following and service (mission).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Peter/Gideon/Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) only begins after the primary program (grace) has established the 'firm ground of salvation'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We are trying to turn ourselves around

voorbeelden: keep the covenant they have made
We are trying to turn ourselves around
the awareness of sin comes only to those...
has power to make our resistance go up in flames
power capable of calling into existence the things that do not exist

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to act where the human subject is 'nonentity' or 'addicted'. Grace is the endowment of competence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from False Security (~S2) to Holy Dread (S2), then through the realization of Sin (~S1) to the irruption of Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God takes the weight of S2 (Judgment) upon Himself in Christ to grant S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The preacher insists that grace is 'terrifying' and God is 'opposed to us' in our sin.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; humans are recipients of an 'irruption' they did not initiate and do not deserve.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Human effort mentioned as a goal
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We are trying to turn ourselves around

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He puts redemption into our blanket
He does not ask us what we are doing... he just gives the gift

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Gideon and Peter are not models of virtue to emulate, but examples of human weakness meeting divine power.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The preacher already uses a theocentric reading: God saves 'even though' they are weak/sinful.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; moving from self-reliance to dependence on mercy.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; grace precedes all human response.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'terrifying God' to the 'loving Savior' is perfectly integrated through the person of Christ.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God is opposed to us' and 'God is for us'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: paying in his own body the price of sin

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit/Word provides the 'Pouvoir' (Fear not) that the human lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an addiction and a rebelliousness that leads to being 'lost'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's initiative. The human subject is correctly positioned as the Receiver of the primary action.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace-oriented distribution.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It avoids the trap of turning biblical figures into moral heroes, instead presenting them as actants of divine mercy.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'funny' Gideon anecdote; semiotics reveals Gideon is a 'non-subject' empowered by the 'Sender'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Babylonian context; semiotics explains how the 'New Thing' functions as a narrative irruption.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'addict' and 'Peter' occupy the same actantial slot (Receiver), making the grace universal.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully uses the 'Heavy Opponent' to necessitate a 'Subject-switch' to Christ.
